headers.subject: [issue3774] tkinter Menu.delete bug
headers.received: from bag (HELO bag.python.org) (127.0.0.1) by bag.python.org with SMTP; 16 Sep 2008 14:26:01 +0200
headers.list-id: List which receives bug reports on Python <python-bugs-list.python.org>

body.para: It may be because I'm calling delete incorrectly (I don't think so - see below) but I'm getting an error

File "C:\CCPN\ccpn\python\memops\gui\Menu.py", line 127, in deleteMenuItems self.delete(0, Tkinter.END) File "C:\Python-2.6_svn\lib\lib-tk\Tkinter.py", line 2670, in delete if c in self._tclCommands: TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable
Which can easily be fixed with
- if c in self._tclCommands: + if c and c in self._tclCommands:
Should I create a patch or have I missed something? Thanks.
